attributes.action: Those civilians have been forgotten by the world
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Mr.Ravi Cumaraswamy
                                                                            47 Buckingham Gardens
       Edgware
                                                                            HA8 6NB                                                                                             

                                                                              30/01/09
Mr Gordon Brown
Honourable Prime Minister
House of Commons
London 
SW1A 2AA         
Dear Honourable Prime Minister

Re: Stop SriLanka’s War of Genocide Against Tamils Humanitarian Crisis in Vanni Over 500 People Dead More Than 1000 Injured 

I as a member of British Citizen of  Edgware  constituency, write to you with deep concern about the current humanitarian crisis facing Tamil people in  Sri Lanka. Ethnic cleansing of the Tamils is evident by every day discriminate shelling and aerial bombardment by the Government of SriLankan .Over 500 people are dead, 1000 injured and bodies scattered all over the places. The displaced four lacks civilian are hiding under the tree in distorted condition, the mothers are helpless to look after their infants, the elderly people been left where ever they are, starve to death. 

Those civilians have been forgotten by the world!!!

Why you are very silence?

I wish to appeal to you, put a pressure on SriLankan government and 
to immediately stop killing of Tamils and find a political solution.

Thanking you in anticipation 

Yours sincerely

Mr Ravi Cumaraswamy

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
